Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Vignolo - Potato Shed has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Vignolo - Potato Shed continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Vignolo - Potato Shed's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Vignolo - Potato Shed's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Vignolo - Potato Shed has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Vignolo - Potato Shed has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Vignolo - Potato Shed now thinks of the RMP-PSM program

Vignolo - Potato Shed has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for a process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Chlorine

The chlorination process at the Vignolo - Potato Shed facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates for only a few months out of the year. The chlorination process utilizes one [QUANTITY (lbs.)] cylinder, with another cylinder stored next to it as a backup. As with the ammonia process management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of a chlorine leak. 

Vignolo - Potato Shed personnel monitor the chlorination process. In addition, the process is checked frequently during the operational season by our outside water treatment contractor. This contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our chlorine equipment.

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Vignolo - Potato Shed has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Vignolo - Potato Shed's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- Cal/OSHA's Emergency Action Plan  Title 8 CCR 3220
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR 1910.38
- Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 8 CCR 5189(n)
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]- Title 29 CFR 1910.119(n)
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 2765.1-2765.2
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Tit

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Descriptions

The chlorine process consists of two (2) chlorine ton containers which are located in the chlorine storage area in the
middle of the property. Other system components are located adjacent to the ton containers, or in the potato wash
process area and consist of the following:
(1) Water pump
(1) Chlorinator
(1) Buffer tank

At Vignolo Farms Potato Shed chlorine gas (Cl2) is used for disinfection of water distributed to residential and irrigation
customers. The chlorine, when added to water, yields both chloric (HCl) and hypochlorous (HOCl) acid (see chemical

equation below) in aqueous solution. This combination is effective in killing bacteria, viruses, pathogens and other micro-
organisms. Note that the equation below is easily reversible which results in off-gassing of chlorine gas from water that

contains high concentrations of the acids.

Cl2 + H2O → HOCl + HCl

The chlorination process begins with the chlorine gas being drawn from the ton container through a pressure reducing
valve, reduced to vacuum at a vacuum regulator valve mounted inside one of three chlorinators, metered through a
manually-adjusted rate valve, and finally injected into water.


1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of chlorine in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program  Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR 68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR 5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR 1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Vignolo - Potato Shed has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Vignolo - Potato Shed, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Vignolo - Potato Shed has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                     | Process Chemical                | Process Quantity(lbs.)
P2 Chlorine                           Chlorine                                  4,000


Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:
